natural problem: Find the sum of the coefficients in the polynomial $3(x^{10} - x^7 + 2x^3 - x + 7) + 4(x^3 - 2x^2 - 5)$ when it is simplified.
natural solution: The sum of the coefficients in $3(x^{10} - x^7 + 2x^3 - x + 7) + 4(x^3 - 2x^2 - 5)$ is $3 (1 - 1 + 2 - 1 + 7) + 4(1 - 2 - 5) = 3 \cdot 8 + 4 \cdot (-6) = \boxed{0}$. (The sum of the coefficients in a polynomial can be found by setting the variable to 1.)

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 10 - x powr 7 + 2 * x powr 3 - x + 7"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 3 - 2 * x powr 2 - 5"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = 3 * P x + 4 * Q x"
shows  "sum_coefficients R = 0"
a_0.formal solution:

 *)

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 10 - x powr 7 + 2 * x powr 3 - x + 7"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = x powr 3 - 2 * x powr 2 - 5"

a_9.formal problem:
theorem

assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 3 * (x powr 10 - x powr 7 + 2 * x powr 3 - x + 7)"

and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x + Q x"
and h3 : "a = (\<Sum> a. coeff R a)"
